I (24F) have had 2 Achilles tendon lengths on my left leg. growing up once when I was 2 and the other when I was ten. I don‚Äôt want to scare you but some days are better than others. I still experience tightness and walk on my toe. Sometimes I think nothing really changed. I have a built up of scar tissue on my tendon back of my ankle above my heel. I remember it being very painful but they encouraged me to walk anyways. I didn‚Äôt use a walker for long maybe 2 days. Recovery was quick but my biggest mistake was not keeping up thirty physical therapy. My advice is keep up with physical therapy no matter how bad it hurts. Hope you‚Äôll have a better success story than I did.

OP, I am sorry for your loss. I just recently lost my mother about two months ago. July 4th to be exact. I know its not a story-driven game but Animal Crossing seems to be helping me a lot. it just a place where I can go and everyone is happy to see me. Another game you should try is dragon Quest builders 2. it got a pretty straightforward story and endless creative opportunities.  this game also helped distract me in the weeks after my mom passed. if you have any more questions or just want someone to talk just PM me.  know you're not alone.
